he sees a long way ahead and makes

find

his chief study is how to avoid exertion

progress promptitude is valuable
possession it begets reliability people

the perfunctory worker
who is ever procrastinating and as

ordinary business channels alacrity is a

profit it is doubtful whether a
confirmed procrastinator ever succeeded

vigilance is the guard of all the
faculties and powers of the mind it is

it is the close companion and protector
of all success liberty and wisdom
without this watchful attitude of mind a

a failure for the fool is an offence to

the Acme of strength so folly is the
other extreme of weakness the lack of

another name for folly it lies at the

with regard to his action and the effect

is the path of immortality they who are

Ernest Ness is the dedication of the
entire mind to its task we live only in
what we do Ernest people are
dissatisfied with anything short of the
highest excellence in whatever they do
and they always reach that excellence
there are so many that are careless and
half-hearted so satisfied with a poor
performance that the earnest ones shine
apart as it were in their excellence
there are always plenty of vacancies in

who did not fill successfully some
suitable sphere such people are
scrupulous conscientious and painstaking
and cannot rest in ease until the very

that which is of surpassing excellence
whether it be in things material
intellectual or spiritual whatever you

your earnestness beyond your goods in
the
case or on your words and the other your
